content.question: How were European economic systems in the American colonies in the 1500s and 1600s different from existing economic systems in Europe?

choices.label: Most European colonies were based on agriculture.
French colonists engaged in commercial activities such as the fur trade.
Spanish colonists used enslaved Africans to work on plantations.
Most colonial economies were tightly regulated by the imperial and colonial governments.

content.answer: Spanish colonists used enslaved Africans to work on plantations.

topic.text: 1.5: Labor, Slavery, and Caste in the Spanish Colonial System
